Understate: The claim may understate the impact of the funding measures used to keep Medicare from cutting its pay to physicians on programs that pay for treating illnesses disproportionately impacting minorities.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support in terms of providing specific evidence or data to support the assertion that the funding measures will cut payments for treating illnesses disproportionately impacting minorities.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make the problematic assumption that diverting money from other medical programs to avert physician pay cuts will directly result in cuts to payments for treating illnesses disproportionately impacting minorities.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may not consider alternative explanations for the funding measures and their potential impact on payments for treating illnesses disproportionately impacting minorities.
